msIdentifier.repository: The John Rylands Research Institute and Library

msDesc.head: Album of forty folios of paintings and calligraphy, assembled at Lucknow for Swiss mercenary Antoine Polier (d. 1795).

msContents.summary: Album of forty-two folios (originally forty) that feature Persian and South Asian paintings and calligraphy, assembled for Swiss mercenary Colonel Antoine-Louis-Henri Polier (d. 1795), probably at Lucknow and overseen by artist Mihr Chand, between 1780 to 1787. Titled Volume quatorsieme (Volume 14), it is one of twenty-one of Polier's albums that survive today.

msItem.title: Blank Folio
msItem.note: A French inscription at top in Polier's hand identifies this as the fourteenth of twenty-five albums offered for sale in an undated French note (see Weis essay).

listBibl.bibl: F. Weis, 'To Be Viewed from Both Ends: The Surviving Polier Albums', Eighteenth-Century Indian Muraqqaʿs: Audiences – Artists – Patrons and Collectors (Leiden: Brill, 2025), 143–186 (see especially p. 162, tbl. 7.2).

msItem.title: Safavid tinted and gilt drawing of a young Man with a red shawl
msItem.note: Probably 17th-century, influenced by the style of Riz̤ā ‘Abbāsī. Numbered 1 in Polier's hand.

listBibl.bibl: B. W. Robinson, Persian Paintings in the John Rylands Library: A Descriptive Catalogue (London: Sotheby Parke Bennet, 1980), pp. 346–347, no. 1580..

msItem.title: Portrait of the Awadh ruler Burhān al-Mulk Sa‘adat ‘Alī Khān I (b. ca. 1680, r. 1722–1739) with his son Ṣafdar Jang (b. 1708 r. 1739–1754 hawking outdoors.
msItem.note: Inscribed on the interior applied border in Polier's hand: Bouran al Maluck [2] Safdar Jung.

msItem.title: Painting of seven women relaxing at a river
msItem.note: Landscape format. The first of two folios subsequently added to this album

msItem.title: Nasta‘līq Murrakibāt
Combination lettering exercises
msItem.note: Landscape format. Folio numbered 10 in Hindu-Arabic numerals at top-left corner. Calligraphy numbered 2 underneath the start of the second line.

msItem.title: Shāhzādī
Portrait of an unidentified princess
msItem.note: The second of two folios subsequently added to this album

msItem.title: Nasta‘līq Mufradāt wa Murrakibāt
Isolated and combination lettering exercises
msItem.note: Landscape format. Folio numbered 9 in at top-left corner. Calligraphy numbered 1 underneath the start of the second line. Same hand as 3b.

msItem.title: Unidentified standing Mughal prince
msItem.note: Folio numbered 3 in Polier's hand.

msItem.title: Unidentified Persian Ghazal
msItem.note: Same hand as folio 2b.

msItem.title: Unidentified standing, middle-aged Mughal nobleman
msItem.note: Folio numbered 4 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Excerpt from Mas̱navī, Book Six
msItem.author: Jalāl al-Dīn Rūmī, 1207–1273
msItem.note: Detached manuscript folio.

msItem.title: Rustam rests after slaying the White Elephant
msItem.note: Folio numbered 4 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Nastalīq Persian Couplets
msItem.quote: هو المعز. دارم امید از خدای کریم * آن کریمی که قادر است و رحیم | کزبلیات در امان باشی * تا جهانست در جهان باشی |
msItem.colophon: المذنب اسحاق غفر له
Completed by Isḥāq, undated.
msItem.note: Detached manuscript folio. Several scribes by this name appear recorded. Bayānī notes an example in an unidentified album in the Bibliothèque Nationale de France, Paris, potentially by the same scribe, which awaits confirmation.

listBibl.bibl: Mahdī Bayānī, Aḥvāl va Ās̱ār-i Khvushnivīsān, vol. 1 (Tehran: University of Tehran Press, 1345 SH [1967 CE]), p. 58, no. 91.

msItem.title: Mullā Dūpīyāzah rides a nag
msItem.note: Signed Mihr Chand pasar-i Gangā Rām on the lower-right corner. Captioned Mullah Dopiazeh 6 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border. A fictional Mughal-era character of Akbar's court and subject of South Asian comic literature, Mullā Dūpīyāzah's name literally means "double onions", which references a curry sauce made of fresh and fried onions combined. He is frequently depicted riding an emciated horse—a trope ultimatelty derived from medieval Persian satirical literature— together with an emaciated dog. Mihr Chand evidently copied this scene at least twice, from another example preserved in an album that formerly belonged to Jean-Baptiste Gentil now held in the Bibliothèque Nationale de France in Paris, Estampes, Réserve Od 60, folio 25a. The other example he completed appears in British Museum 1920,0917,0.140. See Weis and Roy essays.

listBibl.bibl: M. Roy and J. Benson 'A Newly Identified Muraqqaʿ Assembled for Antoine-Louis-Henri Polier in the British Museum. Appendix: List of Contents in the Polier Album (BM 1920,0917,0.133–153)' Eighteenth-Century Indian Muraqqaʿs: Audiences – Artists – Patrons and Collectors, edited by F. Weis, (Leiden: Brill, 2025), p. 206.

F. Weis, 'To Be Viewed from Both Ends: The Surviving Polier Albums', Eighteenth-Century Indian Muraqqaʿs: Audiences – Artists – Patrons and Collectors, edited by F. Weis, (Leiden: Brill, 2025), p. 149 n42.

msItem.title: Nasta‘līq Persian Couplets
msItem.colophon: الفقیر محمد هاشم الحسینی
Completed by Muḥammad Hāshim al-Ḥusaynī, undated.
msItem.note: Landscape format, rotated 90º counter-clockwise. noticeable break on the right of the calligraphy Bayānī describes a man by this name as father in-law to the poet Muḥammad Afz̤al 'Sarkhush' Lahūrī (ca. 1644-1714) and that an unidentified calligraphy preserved in Punjab Museum may be by him.

listBibl.bibl: Mahdī Bayānī, Aḥvāl va Ās̱ār-i Khvushnivīsān, vol. 1 (Tehran: University of Tehran Press, 1345 SH [1967 CE]), p. 859, no. 1278.

msItem.title: Shāh ‘Abbās I with attendants
msItem.colophon: رقم کمینه‌ٔرضا عباسى
msItem.note: Numbered 7 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border. This appears to be a later copy. See Robinson.

listBibl.bibl: B. W. Robinson, Persian Paintings in the John Rylands Library: A Descriptive Catalogue (London: Sotheby Parke Bennet, 1980), p. 347, no. 1581..

msItem.title: Lines from the Qaṣīdat al-Burdah (Ode of the Cloak)
msItem.author: Būṣīrī, Sharaf al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Saʻīd, ca. 1213-ca. 1296;
msItem.quote:
قد تنكرُ العينُ ضوءَ الشمسِ من رمدٍ * و ينكر
يا خير من يمّم العافون ساحته * سعيا وفوق
ومن هو الاية الكبرى لمعتبر * ومن هو النّعمة العظمى لمغتنم
msItem.note: Landscape format, rotated 90º counter-clockwise. Written on butter-tinted paper. Although unsigned, this style of bold thuluth prevailed in 18th-century Awadh. Hindu-Arabic numeral 27 at bottom-left.

msItem.title: A European women reposes in a state of deshabille
msItem.note: Numbered 8 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Munajāt
Whispered Prayers
msItem.author: ʻAlī ibn Abī Ṭālib, Caliph, approximately 600–661;
msItem.quote:
فَحَبْلُ رَجائي مِنْكَ لا يَتَقَطَّعُ
فَحَبْلُ رَجائي مِنْكَ لا يَتَقَطَّعُ
اِلـهي ذُنُوبي بَذَّتِ الطَّوْدَ وَاْعتَلَتْ * وَصَفْحُكَ عَنْ ذَنْبي اَجَلُّ وَاَرْفَعُ |
ومن هو الاية الكبرى لمعتبر * ومن هو النّعمة العظمى لمغتنم
msItem.note: The repeated initial lines appear to indicate this would be a draft composition. Possibly written on a pale peach tinted paper. Hindu-Arabic numeral 59 at bottom-right.

msItem.title: A satirical drawing of a Safavid rifleman and archer.
msItem.note: For an analysis of this image, see Robinson. Numbered 9 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

listBibl.bibl: B. W. Robinson, Persian Paintings in the John Rylands Library: A Descriptive Catalogue (London: Sotheby Parke Bennet, 1980), p. 279, no. 820..

msItem.title: Unidentified standing Deccani nobelman with a hawk outdoors.
msItem.note: Unnumbered.

msItem.title: Rawz̤at al-Anvār

author.persName: Sabzavārī, Muḥammad Bāqir ibn Muḥammad Muʼmin, d. ca. 1680

msItem.incipit: خواهی رسید که خداوند کار و بنده انجامشان...
msItem.note: Written on apricot-tinted paper, with some insect damage.

msItem.title: A standing unidentified Mughal emperor.
msItem.note: Numbered 11 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Unidentified Persian Ghazal
msItem.incipit: بر خاک و آب جمله روانست حکیم او
msItem.note: Same hand as folio 2b and Folio 5b. Written on paper dusted with gold particles. Margin also flecked with gold before painting.

msItem.title: A drunken musical party in a courtyard
msItem.note: Numbered 12 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border. Interleaving detached from the gutter, crumpled, and torn at the edges.

msItem.title: Excerpt from a poem
msItem.author: Shāfiʻī, Muḥammad ibn Idrīs, Imām, ca. 767–820
msItem.quote: يامن يرى مافي الضمير ويسمع * أنت المعد لكل ما يتوقع | يا من يرجى للشدائد كلهـا * يامن إليه المشتكي والمفزع | يا من خزائن ملكه في قول كن * أمنن فإن الخيـر عنـدك أجمـع
msItem.note: Written on a pale pink "Stormont" type marbled paper with curled designs. Hindu-Arabic numeral 6 at bottom-right.

msItem.title: A princely couple lie on a veranda surrounded by female attendants.
msItem.note: Numbered 13 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Arabic Quatrain
msItem.author: Avicenna, 980–1037
msItem.quote: اعتصام الورى بمعرفتك عجز الواصفون عن صفتك تب علينا فإننا بشر ما عرفناك حق معرفتك
نَادِ عَلِيّاً مَظْهَرَ الْعَجَائِبِ * تَجِدْهُ عَوْناً لَكَ فِي النَّوَائِب | كُلِّ هَمٍّ وَ غَمٍّ سَيَنْجَلِي * بِوَلَايَتِكَ يَا عَلِيُّ يَا عَلِيُّ يَا عَلِيُّ | ِ
msItem.colophon: فقير علي الكاتب
msItem.note: This appears of doubtful authenticity.

msItem.title: Possibly Jahāngīr
msItem.note: Numbered 15 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Nād ‘Alīyān
msItem.author: ‘Alī ibn Abī Ṭālib, 980–1037
msItem.quote: اعتصام الورى بمعرفتك عجز الواصفون عن صفتك تب علينا فإننا بشر ما عرفناك حق معرفتك
نَادِ عَلِيّاً مَظْهَرَ الْعَجَائِبِ * تَجِدْهُ عَوْناً لَكَ فِي النَّوَائِب | كُلِّ هَمٍّ وَ غَمٍّ سَيَنْجَلِي * بِوَلَايَتِكَ يَا عَلِيُّ يَا عَلِيُّ يَا عَلِيُّ | ِ
msItem.note: Mottled blue paper with 7 laid lines per cm and no discernible chain lines.

msItem.title: Unidentified standing Mughal nobleman
msItem.note: Numbered 15 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border, with Hindu-Arabic numeral 17 at bottom-left on the exterior applied border. Interleaving detached and crumpled.

msItem.title: Persian Quatrain celebrating Nawrūz
msItem.quote: یا رب همهٔ فال تو مبارک بادا * روز و مه سال تو مبارک بادا | نورز که غره نشاط و طربیست * با عید جمال تو مبارک بادا
msItem.note: For more on this scribe see Bayānī.

msItem.title: Group of ascetics prepare and drink bhang.
msItem.note: Numbered 16 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Folio detached from an unidentified Persian Ornate Prose Text
msItem.author: Anonymous
msItem.quote: میرزا عبد الحق من آن که همچون مهر و ماه...
msItem.note: Numbered 46 in Hindu-Arabic numerals at bottom-left.

msItem.title: A Mughal princess in a state of deshabille holds a blossom in her left hand
msItem.note: Numbered 17 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Dīvān-i Ishrāq
Munajāt
msItem.author: Mīr Muḥammad Bāqir Dāmād, d. ca 1631
Sanāʼī al-Ghaznavī, Abū al-Majd Majdūd ibn Ādam, -approximately 1150
msItem.quote: با اسمه سبحانه. ای ز تو نه طاق فلک پر شروق ای ز تو آراسته این چار سوق چهره خورشید درخشان ز تست گردش نه چرخ به سامان زتوست گوش من و حلقه افکندگی دوش من و غاشیه بندگی
msItem.colophon: کتبه العبد المذنب محمد سعید غفر له
msItem.note: In the final lines, Mīr Dāmad quotes Sanā'ī. This may possibly be the work of a Quṭb Shāhī court calligrapher, for whom see Bayānī. Numbered 78 in Hindu-Arabic numerals at bottom-left. Written on gold-flecked combed marbled paper.

listBibl.bibl: Mahdī Bayānī, Aḥvāl va Ās̱ār-i Khvushnivīsān, vol. 1 (Tehran: University of Tehran Press, 1345 SH [1967 CE]), p. 747, no. 1080.

msItem.title: Unidentified standing Mughal nobleman
msItem.note: Numbered 18 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.author: Amīr Khusraw Dihlavī, ca. 1253-1325
msItem.quote: دلبران مهر نمایند و وفا نیز کنند دل بر آن مهر نبندی که جفا نیز کنند عالمی را بکش از غمزه که ترکان به خدنگ گر چه بکشند بسی صید، رها نیز کنند
msItem.colophon: بتاریخ ربیع الاول سنه ۱۰۶۰ در مکه معظمه تحریر نمود العبد حاجی فاضل غفر له
Completed by Ḥājjī Fāz̤il in Rabī‘ I 1060 AH (March 1650 CE) in Mecca (Makkah).
msItem.note: An attached note at top bears the words ḥaqīr-i faqīr.Numbered 26 at bottom.

msItem.title: A princess reads under a tree
msItem.note: Numbered 19 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border. Numbered 23 in Hindu-Arabic numerals on the exterior applied border at bottom-left

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.author: Ḥāfiẓ, fl. 14th century
msItem.quote: پادشاها لشکر توفیق همراه تواند * خیز اگر بر عزم تسخیر جهان ره می‌کنی | با چنین جاه و جلال از پیشگاه سلطنت * آگهی و خدمت دل‌های آگه می‌کنی |
msItem.colophon: الفقير علي الكاتب
Signed al-Faqīr Mīr ʻAlī.
msItem.note: This appears authentic.

msItem.title: Portrait of Iftikhār Khān Ni‘mat Allāhī al-Ḥusaynī.
msItem.note: Identified by a paper note in Persian, and also numbered 20 on the interior applied border, both in Polier's hand. Iftikhār Khān Ni‘mat Allāhī al-Ḥusaynī governed Kashmir during the reign of ‘Alāmgīr I from 1671 to 1675.

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.author: Ashraf Māzandarānī, Muḥammad Saʻīd, ca. 1620–1702
msItem.quote: تو محی دینی و مصطفی حافظ تو * تو صاحب سیف و مرتضی حافظ تو | تو حامی شرع و حامی تو شارع تو * حافظ قرآن و خدا حافظ تو |
msItem.colophon: کتبه محمد علی دکنی
Signed Katabuhu Muḥammad ‘Alī Dakkanī.
msItem.note: Painted gold ground and sprayed with gold particles after completion.

msItem.title: Portrait of Jahāngīr wearing a chakdār jāmah (four-pointed tunic)
msItem.note: Numbered 21 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border. .

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.author: Niẓāmī
msItem.quote: تو محی دینی و مصطفی حافظ تو * تو صاحب سیف و مرتضی حافظ تو | تو حامی شرع و حامی تو شارع تو * حافظ قرآن و خدا حافظ تو |
Fragments: یارب ز تو آنچه من گدا می خواهم * افزون ز هزار پادشا می خواهم | هر کس ز در تو حاجتی می خواهد * من آمده ام از تو ترا می خواهم
Top Interior Fragment: ای درویش خدا تعالی را فراموش مکن مه بهترین صفات اینست از غیر خدا...
Interior fragments: کرامت جوانمردی و نان دهی است مقالات بیهوده طبل تهی است
msItem.colophon: کتبه محمد علی دکنی
Signed Mashaqahu al-‘Abd al-Muẕannib Maḥmūd bin Īsḥāq al-Shihhābī ghafar ẕunūbuhumā.
msItem.note: Ornate prose fragments at top and bottom await identification.

msItem.title: Horseman Hawking
msItem.colophon: مشقه رضا عباسى
msItem.note: Landscape format. While Robinson interprets this as a late-16th century Safavid drawing recoloured in India, it appears to actually be an intentional fake bearing a dubious signature of Dubious signature of Riz̤ā ‘Abbāsī. Numbered 22 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border.

listBibl.bibl: B. W. Robinson, Persian Paintings in the John Rylands Library: A Descriptive Catalogue (London: Sotheby Parke Bennet, 1980), p. 279, no. 821..

msItem.title: Unidentified Ghazal
msItem.quote: گر بلند همتت ای دل * کرد کردم بهیچگونه نکرد | که جکال قناعت آن اولی * کز عبار طمع نگیرد کرد | آب کرمیست هر طعام که هست * شربت خوشگو ازالی سرو
msItem.colophon: العبد المذنب عبــد الله الله غفر له
Signed al-‘abd al-muẕannib ‘Abd Allāh ghafar lahu.
msItem.note: The initial part of the calligrapher's signature at bottom-left is partly cut off, but probably reads ‘Abd Allāh.
numbered 6 at bottom-left

msItem.title: A group of mystics
msItem.note: This scene recalls Safavid exemplars. Numbered 23 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border. Interleaving torn out from gutter. Break in sewing.

msItem.title: Ghazal
msItem.author: Muḥtasham, ʻAlī ibn Aḥmad, ca. 1499–1588
msItem.quote: Fragments: دلم بی تو هرگز قـراری نداشت * بکوی فراغت گذاری نداشت | بدین خوشی روزگاری نداشت * بسی درد‌ها ديد مجنون ولی
msItem.colophon: العبد المذنب معز الدین محمد الحسینی غفر ذنبه فی سنه ۹۸۵
Completed by Mu‘izz al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī, fl. late 16th c. in 985 AH (1577–1578 CE).
msItem.note: central calligraphy written on pink and gold sprayed paper outlined in gold ink. Fragments wrtitten on pale apricot tinted paper with gold floral scrollwork illuminated ground.

msItem.title: A princess in a state of deshabille holds a small golden cup
msItem.note: Numbered 24 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.quote: رنگین منکر گیاه این گشت * کاول سمن است و اخر انگشت | هر سرو و گلی که رویداز خاک *‌فردا همه هسیر مست و خاشاک
msItem.colophon: کتبه العبد الاقل المذنب معز الدین محمد الحسینی غفر ذنبه سنه ۹۷۲
Completed by Mu‘izz al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Ḥusaynī, fl. late 16th c. in 972 AH (1564–1565 CE).
msItem.note: written over a sprayed stencilled paper in pale pink, with figures outlined in gold. includng deer, gazelle, a janissary, palm trees "kissing birds", and a lion, with a large ornamental tree at top-right.

msItem.title: A prince consults an advisor while resting during a hunt
msItem.note: Numbered 25 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.quote: هلاک تیغ ترا اجرآن قدر باشد * که نی نصیب ز رخمت کند شهیدانرا | جز حیرت نظاره لیلی هسج باب * نسکین بقراری مجنون نمیشود
msItem.colophon: فقیر عبد الرحیم هروی
msItem.note: Numbered 32 at bottom-left.

msItem.title: An unidentified Mughal emperor.
msItem.note: Numbered 26 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Unidentified quatrain
msItem.quote: شمعا پر پروانه نداری رسدت * در کوی وفا خانه نداری رسدت | آنت نرسد که کویم دوست مدار * آری اگرم دوست نداری رسدت
msItem.note: Numbered 24 at bottom-left.

msItem.title: An amourous couple embrace
msItem.note: Numbered 27 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Murrakibāt
msItem.colophon: محمد عارف الهروی سنه ۱۱۹
msItem.note: Landscape format. Numbered 12 at bottom-right.

msItem.title: An unidentified standing Mughal nobleman
msItem.note: Numbered 28 in Polier's hand on the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.incipit: کلید فتح ممالیک در آسمن تو باد
msItem.colophon: محمود عاقبت

msItem.title: An unidentified standing Mughal prince or emperor
msItem.note: Numbered 29 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.note: Numbered 29 in Hindu-Arabic numerals at bottom-left.

msItem.title: Portrait of Nawwāb Iftikhār Khān bin Aṣālat Khān Ni‘mat Allāhī al-Ḥusyanī
msItem.note: Numbered 30 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Excerpt from a ghazal
msItem.quote: سحرگاهان که مخمور شبانه * گرفتم باده با چنگ و چغان | نگار مِی‌فروشم عشوه‌ای داد * که ایمن گشتم از مکر زمانه |
msItem.note: Numbered 34 in Hindu-Arabic numerals at bottom-left.

msItem.title: Portrait of of an unidentified European woman
msItem.note: Numbered 31 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Excerpt from a ghazal
msItem.quote: آن کس که به دست، جام دارد * سلطانیِ جَم، مُدام دارد | ما و مِی و زاهدان و تقوا * تا یار سرِ کدام دارد |
msItem.colophon: فقیر عبد الرحیم هروی عنبرین یقلم جهانگیرشاهی فی شهور سنه ۱۰۲۱
Completed by ‘Abd al-Raḥīm Haravī ‘Anbarīn Qalam in 1021 AH (1612–1613).
msItem.note: Numbered 9 in Hindu-Arabic numerals at bottom-left.

msItem.title: An unidentified sage with his books
msItem.note: Numbered 32 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Murrakibāt
msItem.colophon: حرره محمد عارف
msItem.note: Numbered 12 in Hindu-Arabic numerals at bottom-left.

msItem.title: An unidentified Mughal emperor
msItem.note: Numbered 33 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border. Numbered 17 in Hindu-Arabic folios at the bottom-left of the painting.

msItem.title: Folio detached from a Dīvān
msItem.colophon: حرره محمد عارف
msItem.note: Numbered 17 in Hindu-Arabic numerals at bottom-left.

msItem.title: A female musician plays a stringed instrument while an ascetic faints
msItem.note: This scene reflects European influcence of the seated female musician, but the image of the ascetic reflects prevailing depictions of the mystic Majnūn. Numbered 34 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.colophon: کتبه العبد المذنب الرّجی نور الدین محمد اللاهیجی غفر الله ذنوبه ۱۰۲۵
Completed by Nūr al-Dīn Muḥammad al-Lāhījī in 1025 AH (1616 CE)

msItem.title: A yogini visits an ascetic with lion
msItem.note: Landscape format. This scene reflects prevailing images of yoginis and the ascetic Kabīr, albeit here with a lion instead of weaving. Numbered 35 in Polier's hand underneath the interior applied border.

msItem.title: Excerpt from a ghazal
msItem.quote: دادگرا تو را فلک جرعه کش پیاله باد * دشمن دل سیاه تو غرقه به خون چو لاله باد | چون به هوای مدحتت زهره شود ترانه‌ساز * حاسدت از سماع آن محرم آه و ناله باد |
msItem.colophon: الحقیر الفقیر عبد الله الحسینی
Completed by ‘Abd Allāh al-Ḥusaynī.

msItem.title: Portrait of Multifat Khān Ni‘mat Allāhī al-Ḥusaynī.
msItem.note: Identified by a paper note in Persian, and also numbered 36 on the interior applied border, both in Polier's hand. He was the younger brother of Iftikhār Khān Ni‘mat Allāhī al-Ḥusaynī depicted above on folio 22a.

msItem.title: Excerpt from the Būstān

author.persName: Saʿdī Shīrāzī, Muṣliḥ al-Dīn bin ʿAbd Allāh, -1292

msItem.quote: گدایی که بر خاطرش بند نیست * به از پادشاهی که خرسند نیست | گدا را چو حاصل شود نان شام * چنان خوش بخسبد که سلطان شام |
msItem.colophon: ناقله العبد المذنب الفقیر محمد مومن عفر ذنوبه سنه ۱۰۴۷
Completed by Muhammad Mu'min 1047 AH (1637–1638 CE).
msItem.note: Two other fragments bear secondary inscriptions possibly attributing them to Muḥammad Ḥusayn and possible ‘Ali Tabrīzī at bottom and right. Numbered 104 in Hindu-Arabic numerals at bottom-left.

msItem.title: A couple embrace while watching a lightining storm on a veranda
msItem.note: Numbered 37 on the interior applied border in Polier's hand.

msItem.title: Excerpt from the Bahāristān
msItem.editor:
Mīr ʻAlī Ḥusaynī al-Haravī, ca. 1476–1544;
میر علی الهروی
msItem.quote: گدایی که بر خاطرش بند نیست * به از پادشاهی که خرسند نیست | گدا را چو حاصل شود نان شام * چنان خوش بخسبد که سلطان شام |
msItem.colophon: کتبه الفقیر المذنب میر علی الکاتب فی محرم الحرام سنه ۹۳۷
Completed by Mīr ʻAlī Ḥusaynī al-Haravī Muḥarram 937 AH (Sep. 1530 CE).

msItem.title: An unidentified nobleman seated on a terrace holds a hawk while an attendant fans him.
msItem.note: Numbered 38 on the interior applied border in Polier's hand.

msItem.title: An unidentified bird on a bright yellow ground.
msItem.note: Lanscape format. Numbered 39 on the interior applied border in Polier's hand.

msItem.title: Quatrain
msItem.author: Badakhshī, Mullā Shāh, ca. 1589–1662
msItem.quote: زبر وزیر اگر شود عالم * ای بدخشی چه غم که در گذر است | کین فلک همچو شيشه ساعت * ساعتی زیر و ساعتی زیر است |

msItem.title: Indian paonting of a Safavid prince.
msItem.note: Lanscape format. Numbered 40 underneath the interior applied border in Polier's hand.

msItem.title: Blank
msItem.note: Same tones but different designs as on folio 1a.

physDesc.additions: Bookplates: Left pastedown: Bibliotheca Lindesiana with pencilled shelfmark 5/D.

binding.p: Originally bound in for Polier in Lucknow, then later restored for subsequent owner Alexander Lindsay, 25th Earl of Crawford (1812–1880).

Folios joined with silk strips in the gutters to form binions. When restored, heavily flocked, machine-made blue paper flyleaves and interleaving added, then resewn on five recessed cords. Edges untrimmed, with front-bead decorative endbands sewn in red and blue silk threads at at head and tail. Originally covered in full claret-coloured goatskin leather over pasteboards, dyed brown along the margins, with light blue silk lining the board interiors. Spine replaced with black goatskin leather, hollow-backed when restored.
binding.decoNote: Boards lavishly decorated with central scalloped mandorlas, detached pendants, cornerpieces, surrounded by cartouche borders, all blocked in gold. Vertical lines connnect the central decoration, embellished with hand-painted raidiating lines and flourishes, with the same added to the surrounding margin. Gold ruled double lines connnect the cornerpieces and define the intermediate margin, dyed brown for contrast, with the same again connected the surrounding cartouches. Comparatively wide gold ruling surrounds the board margins, now largely abraded.
binding.condition: Handle binding with caution. In poor condition, with extensive abrasion to the exterior leather, breaking headcaps, bumped corners, right board broken at the interior joint. Boxed.

history.origin: Probably assembled by Mihr Chand for Colonel Antoine-Louis-Henri Polier (1741–1795) in Lucknow undated, but circa 1773–1780 CE.

provenance.p: Likely taken with Polier when he returned to Europe.
After Bland's death, London bookseller Bernard Quaritch (1819–1899) sold his oriental manuscripts to Alexander Lindsay, 25th Earl of Crawford (1812–1880) in 1866.
Purchased by Enriqueta Rylands (1843–1908) in 1901 from James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford (1847–1913).

acquisition.p: Bequeathed by Enriqueta Rylands (1843–1908) in 1908 to the John Rylands Library.

source.p: Bibliographical description based on a manuscript catalogue by Michael Kerney, circa 1890s.
Manuscript description by Jake Benson in 2025 with reference to the volume in hand.

availability.p: To book an in-person or online appointment to consult the manuscript, visit Using the Special Collections Reading Rooms. For any other enquiries please email uml.special-collections@manchester.ac.uk.

listBibl.bibl: F. Weis, ed. Eighteenth-Century Indian Muraqqaʿs: Audiences, Artists, Patrons and Collectors. Leiden: Brill, 2025.

revisionDesc.change: Jake Benson Completed the manuscript description with reference to the volume in hand.
